subject: Sales
title: Mandela's Long Game
description: A quick, practical guide to Mandela's Long Game.

hook.text: Mandela spent 27 years in prison. He used that time to study his captors and learn their language.

buildup.text: He learned Afrikaans to negotiate with his jailers in their own tongue. Respect was his weapon.

discovery.text: He turned enemies into allies through patience. Guards who once despised him became his advocates.

twist.text: When he finally negotiated with de Klerk, Mandela had more moral authority than any army could.

climax.text: The transition happened without civil war. His patience achieved what decades of violence couldn't.

punchline.text: Patience and respect can defeat any opponent.

quiz.question: What did Mandela do in prison to prepare for negotiation?
options: Learned Afrikaans and studied his captors
